data_entries.content:
Department Name: AI Software Department - Computer Information Series - Yeongjin University of Technology  
Educational Goal: To cultivate practical skills aimed at training developers of artificial intelligence and big data application software  
Core Curriculum: Basic AI technologies, machine learning, deep learning, web/mobile/IoT software development  
Features: Fostering key software talent for the Fourth Industrial Revolution  
Potential Employers: Kakao, Naver, Coupang, Samsung Electronics, KB Kookmin Bank, Nonghyup, Daegu Bank, etc.  
Professional Certifications: ORACLE OCP-DBA, OCAJP/OCPJP, LPIC, Big Data Analysis Engineer, SQL-D  
Major Learning Subjects: Object-Oriented Programming, Database, Capstone Design  
Development Fields: AI/Big Data Development, Web-Based Solution Development, Mobile and IoT Development
data_entries.summary: The AI Software Department at Yeongjin University of Technology aims to develop practical skills for training developers in artificial intelligence and big data application software. The core curriculum includes basic AI technologies, machine learning, deep learning, and software development for web, mobile, and IoT. The program focuses on cultivating key software talent to meet the demands of the Fourth Industrial Revolution, with potential employers including major companies like Kakao, Naver, and Samsung Electronics. Students can obtain professional certifications such as ORACLE OCP-DBA and Big Data Analysis Engineer, while major subjects include Object-Oriented Programming and Database. The development fields covered include AI/Big Data Development and web-based solution development.

data_entries.content_kr:
﻿최다 IT 인재 양성 : 재학생 약 1,000명, 4년제 포함 전국 최대 (2024년 대학알리미 공시자료)
4차 산업혁명 유망 분야 : 네이버, 시스코, 넥슨, NC 소프트 등 IT 기업 진출
해외 취업 전국 최고 : 16년간 581명, 2024년 50명 해외 취업 배출
일본 글로벌 대기업 취업 : 소프트뱅크, NTT, 라쿠텐 등 161명 취업
4년제 학사학위 취득 : 13년째 전공심화과정 운영, 경북대·영남대 대학원 진학자 배출
data_entries.content:
- Producing the most IT talents: Approximately 1,000 current students, the largest nationwide including four-year universities (2024 University Information Disclosure Data)
- Promising fields in the 4th Industrial Revolution: Entry into IT companies such as Naver, Cisco, Nexon, and NC Soft
- Highest overseas employment nationwide: 581 individuals over 16 years, with 50 individuals expected to be employed overseas in 2024
- Employment in global Japanese corporations: 161 individuals employed at companies like SoftBank, NTT, and Rakuten
- Obtaining a four-year bachelor's degree: Operating a specialized major program for 13 years, producing graduates who advance to graduate schools at Kyungpook National University and Yeungnam University
data_entries.summary: The institution is recognized for producing the largest number of IT talents in the country, with around 1,000 current students, and has a strong track record of graduates entering prominent IT companies like Naver and Cisco. It boasts the highest overseas employment figures, with 581 individuals employed abroad and an additional 50 expected to join them in 2024. Furthermore, 161 graduates have found positions in major Japanese corporations such as SoftBank and NTT. The institution has also maintained a specialized major program for 13 years, facilitating the advancement of its graduates to graduate schools at Kyungpook National University and Yeungnam University.

data_entries.content:
Advanced Field Talent Development Innovation Convergence University  
The only specialized college in the field of artificial intelligence, supported by a consortium with 70 billion won over six years.  
Joint education and degree programs selected for LINC 3.0 with Chonnam National University, Sungkyunkwan University, Kyungpook National University, University of Seoul, Korea University of Technology and Education, and Jeonju University.  
The Ministry of Education's project to foster leading specialized colleges in industry-academic-research cooperation provides an average support of around 2 billion won per school over six years.  
Operating a major specialization program for the 12th year, with a metaverse agreement class and a cloud computing agreement class.
data_entries.summary: The Advanced Field Talent Development Innovation Convergence University is a specialized institution focused on artificial intelligence, backed by a consortium with a funding of 70 billion won over six years. It collaborates with several universities, including Chonnam National University and Korea University of Technology and Education, to offer joint education and degree programs under the LINC 3.0 initiative. The Ministry of Education supports this project to enhance industry-academic-research cooperation, providing an average of 2 billion won per school over six years. Additionally, the university has been operating a major specialization program for 12 years, featuring classes in metaverse and cloud computing.

Welcome!  
As a member of Youngjin Polytechnic University, you will receive various admission information and school news.  
Examinees can obtain various information on the admission homepage (ipsi.yju.ac.kr).  
Current students (new students) and graduates can find various information on the web portal (www.yjp.ac.kr).  
* For dormitory registration and successful applicant inquiries, please log in at [Campus Life - Dormitory].  
* Examinees can retrieve their ID/password on the admission homepage.
data_entries.summary: The document outlines the academic calendar and important dates for Youngjin Polytechnic University, including graduation review meetings, course registration periods, and holidays for the 2024 and 2025 academic years. Key events include the entrance ceremony for the 49th academic year, various registration and correction periods for current students, and the commemoration of significant dates such as Children's Day and the school's founding anniversary. Additionally, it provides information for examinees and current students regarding accessing admission information and campus resources through designated websites. The calendar emphasizes the importance of timely registration and participation in academic activities throughout the year.

Training the Most IT Talents

Best overseas employment nationwide  
The highest number of overseas job placements in the country  
581 individuals over 16 years, 50 individuals in 2024  
161 employed at major Japanese global companies such as SoftBank, NTT, and Rakuten

Producing graduates who advance to graduate schools such as Kyungpook National University and Yeungnam University
data_entries.summary: The Computer Information Department boasts approximately 1,000 enrolled students, making it the largest nationwide among four-year institutions, according to 2024 University Information Disclosure Data. It is recognized as a promising field within the 4th Industrial Revolution, with graduates securing employment at major companies like Naver, Cisco, Nexon, and NC Soft. The department also leads the nation in overseas job placements, with 581 individuals employed over the past 16 years and 50 in 2024 alone, including 161 graduates working for prominent Japanese companies such as SoftBank and NTT. Operating a specialized program for 13 years, the department successfully prepares students for further education, with many advancing to graduate schools like Kyungpook National University and Yeungnam University.

data_entries.content:
Computer Information Program Educational Objectives  
Cultivating key IT talents for the 4th Industrial Revolution era!  
Artificial Intelligence and Big Data Developers  
Web-based Enterprise Solution Developers  
Android and iOS App Developers  
2D/3D Game Developers  
Metaverse Content Creators  
Game Planners, QA, and Operators  
Cloud System Experts  
Network and System Engineers  
Japanese IT System Developers  
Japanese IT System Engineers  
Bachelor's Degree Advanced Program (Day/Night, 1-Year)  
Project Managers (PM), Information Processing Engineers, Preparation for Overseas Employment (Day Classes)
data_entries.summary: The Computer Information Program aims to develop essential IT professionals for the 4th Industrial Revolution, focusing on various roles such as Artificial Intelligence and Big Data developers, web-based enterprise solution developers, app developers for Android and iOS, and creators of 2D/3D games and metaverse content. The program also prepares students for positions as project managers, information processing engineers, and specialists in cloud systems, networks, and Japanese IT systems. It offers a Bachelor's Degree Advanced Program available in both day and night classes, along with training for overseas employment.

data_entries.summary: The AI Software Department at Youngjin Polytechnic University focuses on cultivating global leaders in artificial intelligence and big data, training software developers in web, mobile, and IoT applications. The curriculum emphasizes practical skills, ranging from basic IT knowledge to advanced software development, preparing students for careers in leading AI and big data companies like Kakao and Naver. Key areas of study include machine learning, deep learning, web solutions, Oracle database management, and IoT technologies, with a strong emphasis on hands-on experience through capstone projects. The program aims to produce core software talents equipped with the necessary skills for the Fourth Industrial Revolution, including certifications in various relevant technologies.

data_entries.summary: The academic calendar for the 2025 academic year outlines important dates and deadlines for both the first and second semesters. The first semester begins on March 4, 2025, with various application periods for early graduation, course registration, and credit withdrawals occurring throughout March and April. Midterm exams are scheduled for late April, followed by final exams in June, concluding the first semester on June 23. The second semester starts on September 1, 2025, with similar application and registration processes, midterm exams in late October, and a series of deadlines extending into November.

data_entries.summary: Sungkyunkwan University's 2025 academic calendar outlines key dates and events for the academic year, starting with the 1st semester on March 1st. Important activities include course registration, applications for early graduation, credit waivers, and midterm exams throughout March and April. May features deadlines for leave of absence applications and final evaluations, leading to the conclusion of the 1st semester with final exams in June. The calendar also highlights summer vacation, the announcement of grades, and deadlines for thesis submissions for graduate students expected to graduate in August.

data_entries.content_kr:
인공지능을 사회문제 해결에 활용할 수 있는 사회적 인공지능 융합 인재 양성
각 산업과 사회에 인공지능 활용을 극대화하고 이를 통한 분야 별 문제해결 능력을 가진 인재 양성

Problem-Solver
인문사회에 대한 이해를 바탕으로 각 산업과 사회가 직면한 문제를 인공지능과 관련된 문제해결 도구로 해결할 수 있는
Convergence Leader
융합연구에 대한 독립성, 진취성, 주체성을 갖추어, 급변하는 세계 시장과 각 산업 내에서 인공지능을 활용하여 선도적 경쟁력을 갖춘
Thinker + Maker = Creator
인공지능 전문성 및 실제 관련 문제의 융합적 해결 능력을 가진

인문사회캠퍼스 최초의 공학계열
일반대학원 석사/석박사통합/박사과정 교육 및 연구를 제공
산학연 현장중심의 문제 해결을 위한 인공지능 혁신, 디지털 트랜스포메이션, 관련 융합 연구 수행
국내외 유수 대학, 기업, 연구소와의 협력을 통한 인공지능융합연구 수행
각종 연구활동 지원 제도 운영(연구 장학금, 해외 저명학회 참여, 국내외 연수, 해외 교육 참여 등)

인공지능을 실제 산업과 시장에 활용하고자 하는 국내외 기업과 연구소
데이터 분석과 활용, 이를 통한 인공지능 적용에 전문성을 가지고자 하는 다양한 산업군 내 기업
인공지능 활용과 관련한 대학과 교육기관 등
data_entries.content:
Cultivating Socially Responsible AI Convergence Talent to Solve Social Issues  
Maximizing the use of artificial intelligence in various industries and society, and nurturing talent with problem-solving abilities specific to each field.

Problem-Solver  
Based on an understanding of the humanities and social sciences, capable of solving problems faced by various industries and society using AI-related problem-solving tools.

Convergence Leader  
Equipped with independence, proactivity, and agency in convergence research, utilizing AI to achieve leading competitiveness in the rapidly changing global market and within various industries.

Thinker + Maker = Creator  
Possessing expertise in artificial intelligence and the ability to converge solutions to real-world problems.

The First Engineering Program in the Humanities and Social Sciences Campus  
Providing education and research for master's, integrated master's and doctoral, and doctoral programs in a general graduate school.  
Conducting AI innovation, digital transformation, and related convergence research focused on solving real-world problems in collaboration with industry and academia.  
Performing AI convergence research in cooperation with prestigious domestic and international universities, companies, and research institutes.  
Operating various research support systems (research scholarships, participation in renowned international conferences, domestic and international training, participation in overseas education, etc.).

Domestic and international companies and research institutes aiming to apply AI to actual industries and markets.  
Companies within various industries seeking expertise in data analysis and utilization, and the application of AI through this.  
Universities and educational institutions related to the use of artificial intelligence.
data_entries.summary: The initiative focuses on cultivating socially responsible AI convergence talent to address social issues by maximizing artificial intelligence's application across various industries. It aims to develop problem-solvers who understand the humanities and social sciences, as well as convergence leaders who can navigate the rapidly changing global market with independence and proactivity. The program offers education and research opportunities at the graduate level, emphasizing collaboration with industry and academia to conduct AI innovation and digital transformation. Additionally, it seeks partnerships with domestic and international companies and research institutions to apply AI effectively in real-world contexts.

The labs include the Applied AI & Computer Vision Lab led by Professor Kim Kwang-soo, the MCS Lab by Professor Kim Jae-gwang, and several others such as the Data eXperience Lab and the Human-AI Interaction Lab, each directed by different professors. This structure showcases a diverse range of research initiatives within the field, emphasizing collaboration and specialization among faculty members.

data_entries.content_kr:
인공지능융합전공은 인공지능이 활용되는 모든 산업과 사회 전반에 관련된 분야로 진출할 수 있으며, 그 중에서도 국내외 인공지능 활용을 위한 기업 및 직군에 진출할 수 있음
인공지능 관련 시스템 설계 및 프로그램 개발자, 데이터 사이언티스트, 인공지능 관련 서비스 기획자
빅데이터 분석가, 온라인/모바일 게임개발자, 그 외 인공지능 및 빅데이터를 활용하는 산업 및 분야
data_entries.content: The Artificial Intelligence Convergence Major can lead to various fields related to the utilization of artificial intelligence across all industries and society as a whole, including opportunities in domestic and international companies and job sectors that utilize artificial intelligence. This includes roles such as system designers and program developers related to artificial intelligence, data scientists, planners for AI-related services, big data analysts, online/mobile game developers, and other industries and fields that utilize artificial intelligence and big data.
data_entries.summary: The Artificial Intelligence Convergence Major prepares students for diverse career opportunities in industries that leverage artificial intelligence, both domestically and internationally. Graduates can pursue roles such as system designers, program developers, data scientists, AI service planners, big data analysts, and online/mobile game developers, among others. This major equips individuals with the skills needed to thrive in various sectors that utilize AI and big data technologies.

If the "Research Credit System for Outstanding Students" is completed, the completed courses will be registered as Software Research Credits 1-5 (SWE3042-3046).
The "Research Credit System for Outstanding Students" cannot be recognized multiple times and is only acknowledged once (for students enrolled from 2020 onwards).
Vision Camp: The Vision Camp provides opportunities for students from various majors to enhance their practical skills.
Support for academic societies and clubs: Clubs within the major are established and operated by students, providing support for various activities; currently, clubs related to gaming and artificial intelligence have been established and are in operation.
Mentoring support: Mentoring is provided through upperclassmen and graduate students who have completed the major to coach incoming students from diverse backgrounds on key subjects.

Pre-school (Boot Camp) operation before entering the major: A programming Pre-school (Boot Camp) is conducted during the winter break to facilitate a smooth transition into the major for incoming students from different backgrounds.
Support for students' creative and autonomous activities through various extracurricular programs.
data_entries.summary: The text outlines various capstone project courses designated by majors, including the Capstone Design Project and the Global Convergence Department Capstone Project, along with a Research Credit System for outstanding students that allows for the registration of completed courses as Software Research Credits. It highlights project courses within the Data Science advanced curriculum and mentions the Vision Camp, which enhances practical skills for students across different majors. Additionally, it discusses support for academic societies and clubs, mentoring from upperclassmen, and a programming Boot Camp aimed at easing the transition for incoming students from diverse backgrounds, all aimed at fostering creative and autonomous student activities.

data_entries.content_kr:
1~4학년 전공수업은 모두 인문사회과학캠퍼스(서울) 개설
창의적 사고력과 활용 능력을 고루 갖춘 글로벌 인공지능 전문 인력양성
2019년 9월에 인공지능만을 위한 융합전공으로는 국내 최초로 성균관대학교 인문사회캠퍼스에 설립
교수, 학생, 산업체의 기술/활용/적용 및 융합전문가가 유기적으로 교육과정에 참여하여, 전공 기본 교육은 물론, 산업체의 기술 수요와 실습이 강조된 교육, 그리고 이를 실제 활용하는 데 중점을 맞춘 연구 수행
인의예지의 품성을 가진 사회문제 해결형 인재 양성
빅데이터/인공지능 시대에 대한 이해와 문제해결 능력을 보유한 인재 양성
소프트웨어와 문제 분석, 데이터 활용과 적용 능력을 겸비한 창의적 인재 양성

인공지능융합전공 교육과정은 크게 전공 코어, 전공 심화로 나누어 제공; 대부분의 코어 과목은 이론과 실습을 병행하는 문제해결형으로 진행하며, 전공 심화 과목의 경우 심화과목(Tech Line, Application Line)과 프로젝트 수업으로 구분
인공지능융합전공의 모든 과목은 절대평가방식으로 운영되며, 졸업을 위해서 모든 학부생은 학점 요건과 전공에서 정한 프로젝트 과목과 코어 과목을 이수해야 함
인공지능융합학사 (Bachelor of Applied Artificial Intelligence)
data_entries.content:
All major courses for 1st to 4th year students are offered at the Humanities and Social Sciences Campus (Seoul).  
The program aims to cultivate global AI professionals equipped with both creative thinking and practical skills.  
Established in September 2019 as the first interdisciplinary major dedicated solely to artificial intelligence in South Korea at Sungkyunkwan University's Humanities and Social Sciences Campus.  
Professors, students, and industry experts in technology, application, and integration actively participate in the curriculum, emphasizing not only fundamental education in the major but also training that aligns with industry technology demands and practical applications, as well as research focused on real-world utilization.  
The program fosters talent capable of solving social issues with a character embodying benevolence, righteousness, propriety, and wisdom.  
It develops individuals with an understanding of the big data/AI era and problem-solving abilities.  
The program also nurtures creative talent with skills in software, problem analysis, and data utilization and application.  

The curriculum for the AI Convergence Major is broadly divided into core and advanced major courses; most core subjects are conducted in a problem-solving format that combines theory and practice, while advanced major courses are categorized into specialized subjects (Tech Line, Application Line) and project classes.  
All subjects in the AI Convergence Major are graded on an absolute evaluation basis, and to graduate, all undergraduate students must complete the credit requirements along with the designated project and core subjects in their major.  
Bachelor of Applied Artificial Intelligence.
data_entries.summary: The AI Convergence Major at Sungkyunkwan University's Humanities and Social Sciences Campus, established in September 2019, is South Korea's first interdisciplinary program focused solely on artificial intelligence. It aims to develop global AI professionals with creative thinking and practical skills, integrating input from professors, students, and industry experts to align education with real-world technology demands. The curriculum includes core and advanced courses, emphasizing problem-solving and practical applications, while fostering talent capable of addressing social issues with ethical values. Students must complete specific credit requirements and projects to earn a Bachelor of Applied Artificial Intelligence.

Notable labs include the Applied AI & Computer Vision Lab by Professor Kwang-Soo Kim, the MCS Lab by Professor Eun-Seok Ryu, and the Human-AI Interaction Lab by Professor Ha-Yeon Song, among others. 명륜3가 → 양현관 →명륜새마을금고 → 아남아파트 → 혜화역(4번출구,혜화동사무소앞) → 종로5가역 → 혜화역(1번출구,학교셔틀정류장) → 명륜새마을금고 → 양현관 → 명륜3가
종로 07번 (편도, 명륜새마을금고 출발)
명륜새마을금고(기점) → 서울국제고등학교 → 국민생활관 → 혜화우체국 → 혜화역.서울대병원입구 → 방송통신대앞(회차) → 혜화역.마로니에공원 → 혜화동로터리 → 성균관대학교정문 → 600주년기념관 → 성균관대학교대운동장 → 명륜새마을금고(종점)
102, 104, 106, 107, 108,109, 140, 143, 149, 150, 151, 160, 162, 171, 172, 272, 273, 301
602-1(6011)번
영종도인천공항 → 월드컵경기장입구 → 구성산회관 → 홍제역 → 안국역 → 창덕궁 → 명륜3가(성대앞) → 삼선교 지하철 한성대학교입구 → 돈암동 지하철 성신여대입구

Office Information Bulletin Board | Sungkyunkwan University Department of Artificial Intelligence Convergence  
Humanities and Social Sciences Campus (Seoul) Dasan Economic Hall Room 32541  
02-740-1785  
Humanities and Social Sciences Campus (Seoul) Parking Information  
Subway Line 4, Hyehwa Station Exit 4  
You can walk from Exit 4 or take the shuttle bus from Exit 1.  
Subway Line 3, Anguk Station, Jonggak Station  
You can exit from Anguk Station Exit 2 or Jonggak Station Exits 2 or 3 and take the village bus Jongno-2 to reach inside the campus.  
Hyehwa Station Exit 1 → Bus stop in front of the school entrance (across from the Olleh AS Center Sungkyunkwan University Entrance) → Sungkyunkwan University Main Gate → 600th Anniversary Memorial Hall → Stop (next to the basketball court)  
Payment Method: General credit cards (only cards with postpaid transportation payment function)  
During the semester: Weekdays 07:00 AM - 11:00 PM  
During vacation: Weekdays 07:00 AM - 07:00 PM  
※ No service on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays. (Common)  
Jongno 02 (Round trip, departing from the back gate in front of the Repair Center)  
Back gate Okryucheon → Board of Audit and Inspection → Jeongdok Library (Shinhan Bank) → Anguk Subway Station (Exit 2) → Nakwon Shopping Center → Jonggak Subway Station (Exits 2, 3) → Insadong → Nakwon Shopping Center → Anguk Subway Station → Jeongdok Library (Shinhan Bank) → Board of Audit and Inspection → Back gate Okryucheon  
Jongno 08 (One way, departing from Yanghyeon Hall)  
Myeongnyun 3-ga → Yanghyeon Hall → Myeongnyun Saemaul Geumgo → Anam Apartment → Hyehwa Station (Exit 4, in front of Hyehwa-dong Office) → Jongno 5-ga Station → Hyehwa Station (Exit 1, school shuttle bus stop) → Myeongnyun Saemaul Geumgo → Yanghyeon Hall → Myeongnyun 3-ga  
Jongno 07 (One way, departing from Myeongnyun Saemaul Geumgo)  
Myeongnyun Saemaul Geumgo (starting point) → Seoul International High School → National Living Hall → Hyehwa Post Office → Hyehwa Station, Entrance to Seoul National University Hospital → In front of Broadcasting and Communication University (turnaround) → Hyehwa Station, Marronnier Park → Hyehwa Rotary → Sungkyunkwan University Main Gate → 600th Anniversary Memorial Hall → Sungkyunkwan University Main Stadium → Myeongnyun Saemaul Geumgo (end point)  
102, 104, 106, 107, 108, 109, 140, 143, 149, 150, 151, 160, 162, 171, 172, 272, 273, 301  
602-1 (6011)  
Yeongjongdo Incheon Airport → World Cup Stadium Entrance → Guseongsan Hall → Hongje Station → Anguk Station → Changdeokgung → Myeongnyun 3-ga (in front of Sungkyunkwan University) → Samseonggyo Subway Hansung University Entrance → Donam-dong Subway Sungshin Women's University Entrance  
This site may not display properly if JavaScript is not supported.
data_entries.summary: The Office Information Bulletin Board for the Department of Artificial Intelligence Convergence at Sungkyunkwan University provides essential information regarding campus access and transportation. Located in Dasan Economic Hall Room 32541, the campus can be reached via various subway lines, with specific exits and shuttle bus options detailed for convenience. Parking information and payment methods for transportation are also included, with service hours specified for weekdays and no service on weekends or public holidays. Additionally, several bus routes are outlined, connecting key locations around the university and nearby areas.

data_entries.summary: Sungkyunkwan University offers a comprehensive range of programs and laboratories focused on artificial intelligence and data science across various applications, including social networks, multimedia computing, and user experience. The university's faculty members specialize in diverse areas such as machine learning, natural language processing, virtual reality, and human-computer interaction. Multiple laboratories, such as the Data Science and Social Analysis Laboratory and the AI and Media Lab, facilitate research and development in cutting-edge technologies like generative AI and multimodal learning. The facilities are located in different buildings on campus, providing students and researchers access to advanced resources for their studies and projects. Overall, the department emphasizes interdisciplinary collaboration and innovation in the rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence.

data_entries.summary: The CSV content lists a variety of courses related to data science and artificial intelligence, all categorized as major courses, each offering 3 credits and requiring 6 hours of self-learning, except for one thesis writing course which offers 1 credit and requires 2 hours. The courses cover topics such as statistics, machine learning, computer vision, natural language processing, and ethical considerations in artificial intelligence.

data_entries.summary: The CSV content lists various academic tracks along with their respective professors and courses. The tracks include "Privacy Preserving Data Science" led by Simon Woo, featuring courses on data security, AI, and machine learning; "Internet Services & AI" taught by Lee Dae-ho, covering topics like data analysis and user experience; "Entertainment & AI" under Park Eun-il, focusing on data science in entertainment and media; and "User Interaction" guided by Song Ha-yeon, emphasizing AI design and psychology.

data_entries.content_kr:
저희 사업단의 더불아이는 더불어 성장하는 아이라는 의미와 지능(Intelligence)과 산업(Industry)의 결합한 II 의미를 포함하고 있습니다.
한번 배우고 끝나는 것이 아니라 주변 사람들과 평생을 같이 배우고 성장하는 인재의 양성을 목표로 하고 있습니다.
남과 공유하고 함께 성장하는 “혁신융합대학 사업단”

혁신융합대학은 개방, 공유, 협력을 통해서 같이 성장하는 것을 큰 모토로 하고 있습니다.
서울과학기술대학교 인공지능 혁신융합대학 사업단은 홀로 성장하는 인재가 아니라 같이 배우며 더 크게 성장하는 인재 양성을 목표로 하고 있습니다.
21세기의 첨단 인재는 다양한 능력을 보유해야 합니다.
21세기 직무는 빠르게 성장하는 기술을 따라잡아야 하고, 선도해야 합니다.
새로운 기술을 습득하고, 더욱 발전시키기 위해서는 협력과 상생이 중요한 키워드입니다.
남과 공유하고 함께 나누며 성장하는 인재는 21세기의 새로운 인재상으로 자리 잡을 것입니다.
새로운 시대를 준비하고 미래를 이끌어가는 “창의 인재”

저희 사업단은 학생들이 꿈꾸고, 꿈을 이룩할 수 있는 자질과 경험을 제공합니다.
이를 위해서 서울과학기술대학교는 다양한 전공의 교수님들과 협력을 통해서,
모든 학생이 알아야 하는 기본과정, 인공지능에 특화된 전공 과정, 산업에 특화된 산업 과정을 만들어서 운영합니다.
학생들이 꿈꾸는 내용에 따라서 마이크로디그리, 부전공, 복수전공, 심화전공으로 연계할 수 있고,
인공지능과 산업이 만나는 분야에서 스스로 성장할 수 있는 인재로 성장할 수 있습니다. 감사합니다.
혁신융합대학 사업단장 박종열 교수

항상 공부하는 인재를 위한 ‘더불아이’

- 지역 간.대학 간 교육역량 차이를 해소하기 위해 인적.물적 자원을 상호 공유하여 국가 수준의 핵심인재양성 체계 구축
- 컨소시엄 대학의 자원을 공동활용하여 운영할 수 있도록 수준별 모듈형 표준 교육과정 개발
- 전공에 관계없이 희망학생 누구나 신기술분야 교육과정을 이수할 수 있도록 학생 선택권 대폭 확대
- 사업예산 : 816억원(8개 분야, 48교 내외)
- 사업기간 : ‘21년 ~ ’26년(6년 : 3+3년)
- 지원대상 : 전국 일반대, 산업대, 전문대 재정지원 가능한 대학으로 구성된 컨소시엄

차세대(시스템/지능형) 반도체
바이오헬스(맞춤형 헬스케어 포함)
실감미디어(콘텐츠)(AR/VR 포함)
에너지 신산업(신재생 에너지)
분야별 교육과정 및 사업성과·정보·자원 등 공유, 신기술 분야 간 융·복합 과정 개발, 참여 학생 취·창업 지원 등 다각적 협업 모색
data_entries.content:
Our business unit, "Deobul-Ai," signifies a child that grows together, incorporating the meanings of intelligence and industry through the combination of the two (II). Our goal is to cultivate talents who learn and grow together with those around them throughout their lives, rather than just learning once and finishing.

The "Innovative Convergence University Business Unit" emphasizes sharing and growing together. The AI Innovative Convergence University Business Unit at Seoul National University of Science and Technology aims to nurture talents who grow significantly by learning together, rather than growing in isolation. 

Advanced talents in the 21st century must possess diverse abilities. Jobs in the 21st century need to keep pace with and lead rapidly advancing technologies. Collaboration and coexistence are key elements for acquiring and further developing new technologies. Talents who share and grow together will establish a new model for the 21st century.

Preparing for a new era and leading the future, we aim to cultivate "creative talents." Our business unit provides students with the qualities and experiences needed to dream and achieve their dreams. To this end, Seoul National University of Science and Technology collaborates with professors from various majors to create and operate foundational courses that all students should know, specialized major courses in artificial intelligence, and industry-specific courses.

Depending on their aspirations, students can connect their studies to micro-degrees, minors, double majors, or advanced majors, allowing them to grow as talents in fields where artificial intelligence and industry intersect. Thank you.

Professor Park Jong-yeol, Head of the Innovative Convergence University Business Unit

"Deobul-Ai" for continuously learning talents

- To address disparities in educational capabilities between regions and universities, we aim to establish a national-level core talent development system by mutually sharing human and material resources.
- Develop a modular standard curriculum that can be operated by jointly utilizing the resources of consortium universities.
- Significantly expand student choice so that any student, regardless of their major, can complete courses in new technology fields.
- Project budget: 81.6 billion KRW (8 fields, approximately 48 universities)
- Project duration: 2021 to 2026 (6 years: 3+3 years)
- Support targets: A consortium composed of national universities, industrial universities, and colleges that can receive financial support.

Next-generation (system/intelligent) semiconductors
Biohealth (including personalized healthcare)
Immersive media (content) (including AR/VR)
New energy industries (renewable energy)
Sharing of curricula, project outcomes, information, and resources by field, development of interdisciplinary courses in new technology fields, and multifaceted collaboration to support participating students in employment and entrepreneurship.
data_entries.summary: The "Deobul-Ai" business unit at Seoul National University of Science and Technology focuses on cultivating collaborative and continuously learning talents in the 21st century. It emphasizes the importance of shared growth and diverse skill sets to keep pace with rapidly advancing technologies. The initiative aims to address educational disparities by establishing a national core talent development system and creating a modular curriculum that allows students from various majors to engage in new technology fields. With a project budget of 81.6 billion KRW over six years, it supports a consortium of universities in areas such as next-generation semiconductors, biohealth, immersive media, and renewable energy, fostering interdisciplinary collaboration for student employment and entrepreneurship.

data_entries.content_kr:
인공지능응용학과 - 학과소개 - 졸업 후 진로
(Dep. of Applied Artificial Intelligence)
AI응용학과 전공학생은 AI와 관련한 다양한 분야에 진출할 수 있습니다. AI 전문가로 활동 가능한 분야는, 인공지능, 빅데이터를 비롯해 시스템 및 프로그래밍 전문가로 응용 개발자, 웹 디자이너, 가상현실 및 증강현실 개발자, 인공지능 관련 서비스 기획자, 데이터 사이언티스트로 활동할 수 있으며 삼성전자, 현대자동차 등의 국내외 대기업, ETRI, 항우연, 기계연 등의 연구소 그리고 대학 및 교육기관, 정부기관, 인공지능 관련 벤처기업 등 산업 전반에 걸쳐 그 역할을 감당하게 될 것입니다.
data_entries.content:
Department of Applied Artificial Intelligence - Department Introduction - Career Paths After Graduation  
Students majoring in Applied Artificial Intelligence can enter various fields related to AI. Areas where they can work as AI specialists include artificial intelligence, big data, system and programming experts, application developers, web designers, virtual reality and augmented reality developers, planners for AI-related services, and data scientists. They will take on roles in a wide range of industries, including large domestic and international companies such as Samsung Electronics and Hyundai Motor Company, research institutes like ETRI, Korea Aerospace Research Institute, and Korea Institute of Machinery and Materials, as well as universities, educational institutions, government agencies, and AI-related venture companies.
data_entries.summary: Graduates of the Applied Artificial Intelligence program have diverse career opportunities in various fields related to AI. They can work as AI specialists in areas such as big data, system and programming, application development, web design, virtual and augmented reality, and data science. Potential employers include major corporations like Samsung Electronics and Hyundai Motor Company, research institutes, universities, government agencies, and AI-focused startups.

data_entries.content_kr:
AI응용학과에서는 4차 산업혁명 시대에 인공지능 분야를 선도할 융합형 인재를 양성합니다.
인공지능(Intelligence)과 산업(Industry) 연계를 통해, 인공지능 전문가를 넘어 산업과 인공지능을 리딩할 수 있는 준비된 인재를 육성하는 데에 교육 목적이 있습니다
AI응용학과 학생들은 1, 2학년에 인공지능의 기초 및 핵심기술에 대해 학습하고 3학년부터 인공지능 모델 개발, 인공지능 서비스 기획 등 실제로 인공지능 지식을 바탕으로 제품과 서비스를 만들어 볼 수 있는 프로젝트 기반의 교육을 받습니다.
또한 AI 이외에 학습자의 관심분야(소프트웨어, 기계, 로봇, 환경, 전자, 반도체, 바이오, 신소재, 디자인, 건축, 화학, 인문, 경영)를 복수 전공하도록 하여 AI응용분야의 전문가를 양성할 수 있도록 합니다.
data_entries.content:
The Department of AI Applications trains convergent talents who will lead the field of artificial intelligence in the era of the Fourth Industrial Revolution. The educational objective is to cultivate prepared individuals who can lead both industry and artificial intelligence, going beyond just being AI experts through the integration of artificial intelligence (Intelligence) and industry (Industry). 

Students in the AI Applications Department learn the fundamentals and core technologies of artificial intelligence in their first and second years, and from their third year onward, they receive project-based education that allows them to create products and services based on their knowledge of artificial intelligence, such as AI model development and AI service planning. 

Additionally, students are encouraged to pursue double majors in their areas of interest outside of AI (such as software, machinery, robotics, environment, electronics, semiconductors, bio, new materials, design, architecture, chemistry, humanities, and management) to develop expertise in the field of AI applications.
data_entries.summary: The Department of AI Applications aims to develop convergent talents capable of leading the artificial intelligence sector during the Fourth Industrial Revolution. Its educational approach focuses on equipping students with foundational AI knowledge in their early years, followed by project-based learning in their later years, where they create AI-driven products and services. Furthermore, students are encouraged to pursue double majors in various fields such as software, robotics, and management, enhancing their expertise and application of AI across diverse industries.

data_entries.content_kr:
교양 교육과정은 모든 교양과목을 학문관심영역(이하 “영역”이라 함)으로 분류하여 영역간의 균형 있는 교양교육 실시를 위하여 아래와 같이 기본 원칙을 정하여 편성한다.
○ 교양교과목은 영역별로 분류하며, 영역간의 균형 있는 교육을 도모한다.
○ 필수과목의 지정이나 기타 이수 규정은 별도로 정하여 시행한다.
기초교양(공통필수 교과목)
○ 창의영역, 인성영역, 글쓰기와논리영역은 교양대학에서 주관 운영한다.
- 창의영역 교과목: 창의적 사고
- 인성영역 교과목: 삶의 윤리학, 인간과 공동체
- 글쓰기와 논리영역 교과목: 논리적 글쓰기
○ 국제화영역인 실용영어 의사소통은 국제교류처에서 주관 운영한다.
○ 취업영역인 취창업진로설계는 취업진로본부에서 주관 운영한다.

핵심교양(영역별 교양 교과목)
○ 1 - 5 영역 : 1-3영역은 필수, 4-5영역은 선택과목으로 구성되며 교양대학에서 주관운영한다.
○ (고급)미분적분학(1),(2) 및 일반물리학(1),(2), 일반물리학실험(1),(2) 교과목으로 구성한다.
○ 학과 계열별로 자연과학(Ⅰ) 및 공학(Ⅰ)계열은 12학점, 자연과학(Ⅱ) 및 공학(Ⅱ)계열은 6학점 이수한다.
○ 전공교육의 이수를 위한 기초학습능력 배양을 목적으로 편성하며, 학과별 최대 12학점 범위 내에서 편성한다.
○ 교양대학에서 주관 운영한다. 교양대학은 강사 선임이나 과목 운영과 관련하여 특정 학과에 운영을 의뢰할 수 있다.
○ 외국어영역은 국제교류처(외국어교육팀)에서 주관 운영한다.
○ 체육영역은 스포츠과학과에서 주관 운영한다.
○ 봉사활동은 학생처에서 주관 운영한다.
담당부서 : 학사지원과
전화번호: 02-970-7174, 7175
data_entries.content:
The liberal arts curriculum classifies all liberal arts subjects into academic interest areas (hereinafter referred to as "areas") and establishes the following basic principles for balanced liberal arts education among the areas.

○ Liberal arts subjects are classified by area, promoting balanced education among the areas.
○ The designation of required subjects and other completion regulations are determined separately and implemented.

Basic Liberal Arts (Common Required Subjects)
○ The Creative Area, Character Area, and Writing and Logic Area are managed by the College of Liberal Arts.
- Creative Area subjects: Creative Thinking
- Character Area subjects: Ethics of Life, Humans and Community
- Writing and Logic Area subjects: Logical Writing
○ The Practical English Communication subject in the Internationalization Area is managed by the International Exchange Office.
○ The Career Development Planning subject in the Employment Area is managed by the Career Development Center.

Core Liberal Arts (Area-specific Liberal Arts Subjects)
○ Areas 1 - 5: Areas 1-3 are required, and Areas 4-5 are elective subjects, managed by the College of Liberal Arts.
○ Composed of Advanced Calculus (1), (2) and General Physics (1), (2), General Physics Laboratory (1), (2).
○ Students must complete 12 credits in the Natural Science (I) and Engineering (I) areas, and 6 credits in the Natural Science (II) and Engineering (II) areas based on their department.
○ Designed to cultivate foundational learning abilities for major education, structured within a maximum of 12 credits per department.
○ Managed by the College of Liberal Arts. The College may delegate the appointment of instructors or the operation of subjects to specific departments.
○ The Foreign Language Area is managed by the International Exchange Office (Foreign Language Education Team).
○ The Physical Education Area is managed by the Department of Sports Science.
○ Volunteer activities are managed by the Student Affairs Office.

Responsible Department: Academic Support Division
Phone Number: 02-970-7174, 7175
data_entries.summary: The liberal arts curriculum categorizes subjects into specific academic interest areas to ensure a balanced education across these areas. Common required subjects are managed by the College of Liberal Arts, including Creative Thinking, Ethics of Life, and Logical Writing, while other areas like Practical English Communication and Career Development Planning are overseen by the International Exchange Office and Career Development Center, respectively. Core liberal arts subjects require students to complete credits in Natural Science and Engineering, with specific management by the College of Liberal Arts. Additionally, areas such as Foreign Language Education and Physical Education are managed by designated offices, ensuring a comprehensive liberal arts education.

국제공동연구 및 인턴십
서울과학기술대학교는 전 세계 61개국 301개교 10개 기관과 학술 교류 네트워크를 구축하고 있습니다. 인공지능응용학과에서는 해외 우수 대학과의 글로벌 공동 학위 과정을 계획하고 있으며, 캐나다 Mila 연구소, 독일 Max Planck 연구소, 일본 이화학연구소 등과의 해외 인턴십 기회를 확대할 예정입니다.
인공지능응용학과에서는 인공지능 분야의 다양한 산업적 경험을 가지신 교수님을 모시고, 현장 중심의 학습/연구를 진행할 수 있도록 산업별 필요한 시설을 지속적으로 확충하고 있습니다.
data_entries.content:
Department of Artificial Intelligence Applications - Department Introduction - Student Support  
International Joint Research and Internships  
Seoul National University of Science and Technology has established an academic exchange network with 301 institutions in 61 countries around the world. The Department of Artificial Intelligence Applications is planning a global joint degree program with prestigious overseas universities and aims to expand internship opportunities with institutions such as the Mila Research Institute in Canada, the Max Planck Institute in Germany, and the RIKEN Institute in Japan.  
The Department of Artificial Intelligence Applications invites professors with diverse industrial experience in the field of artificial intelligence and is continuously enhancing facilities required for industry-specific learning and research.
data_entries.summary: The Department of Artificial Intelligence Applications at Seoul National University of Science and Technology has formed an academic exchange network with 301 institutions across 61 countries and is developing a global joint degree program with esteemed international universities. It seeks to broaden internship opportunities with renowned research institutions like the Mila Research Institute in Canada, the Max Planck Institute in Germany, and the RIKEN Institute in Japan. Additionally, the department is actively recruiting professors with varied industrial experience in artificial intelligence and is improving facilities to support industry-focused education and research.

Career Paths After Graduation | University Introduction | Department of Artificial Intelligence  
· Private Sector: All industries including software, gaming, semiconductors, healthcare, and automotive  
· Research Institutions: Naver, Google Research Labs, Artificial Intelligence Research Institute, Korea Electronics and Telecommunications Research Institute, Korea Information Society Development Institute, etc.  
· Public Enterprises: Korea Information and Communication Industry Promotion Agency, Korea Internet & Security Agency, Korea Information Society Development Institute, Korea Data Industry Promotion Agency, Korea Information and Communication Promotion Association, etc.  
· Civil Service: Ministry of Science and ICT, Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy, Ministry of Health and Welfare, Ministry of Environment, Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport, Ministry of Small and Medium Enterprises and Startups, local governments, etc.  
· Academia and Education: University professors, middle and high school teachers  
· Graduate School and Study Abroad: Studying in Korea as well as in the United States, Europe, and other countries
data_entries.summary: Graduates from the Department of Artificial Intelligence have diverse career paths available to them, including opportunities in the private sector across various industries such as software, gaming, and healthcare. They can also pursue positions in research institutions like Naver and Google Research Labs, or work in public enterprises such as the Korea Information and Communication Industry Promotion Agency. Civil service roles are available in multiple ministries, while academia offers positions as university professors or teachers. Additionally, graduates may choose to further their education through graduate school or study abroad programs in countries like the United States and Europe.

data_entries.content_kr:
학과소개 | 대학소개 | 인공지능학과
인간중심의 인공지능을 지향합니다.
인공지능 기술이 가져올 미래 사회와 첨단 기술 및 산업에서의 인공지능의 중추적 역할에 비추어 볼 때, 다양하고 복합적인 인공지능 핵심 기술을 체계적이며 종합적으로 이해하고 활용할 수 있는 탁월한 전문성을 갖춘 윤리적인 인재의 양성을 주도적으로 담당할 인공지능학과의 필요성에 따라 2020년도 4월에 신설되어 인공지능 분야의 수준 높은 교육과 연구를 목표로 우수한 교수진, 첨단 실험실습, 체계적 교과과정 등을 성취하기 위해 노력하고 있습니다. 더 나아가 인공지능학과는 소프트웨어 분야뿐만 아니라 게임, 금융, 반도체, 의료, 자동차, 항공 등 산업 전 분야의 국내외 유명 기업/연구기관에서 국제적인 경쟁력을 갖고 핵심적으로 활동할 인공지능 전문가 양성을 지향합니다.

인공지능학과는 미래 첨단 기술 및 산업 발전의 중추적이며 선도적 학문으로 자리 잡은 인공지능 분야의 창의적이며 실용적 역량을 갖춘 탁월하고 윤리적인 인재 양성을 목표로 하고 있습니다. 서울시립대학교 인공지능학과 교육과정은 실용과 융합을 지향합니다. 첫 번째 목표는 현장에 필요한 인공지능 기술 개발 역량을 키우는 것입니다. 캡스톤디자인, 리빙랩 등현장연계형 교육과정을 이수하며 실전문제를 발굴하고, 이를 해결하는데 반드시 필요한 인공지능 기술을 직접 만들어보게 됩니다. 또 다른 목표는 여러 분야 사람들과 협력을 통해 최신 인공지능 기술을 융합하는 역량을 키우는 것입니다. 학생들은 다학제적 교육과정을 통해 타학문 사람들과 소통하는 방법을 배우고, 인공지능 기술 활용가능성을 다각도로 모색하게 됩니다. 해외 테크회사 및 연구소 구성원들과 인적교류를 계기로 글로벌 인공지능 인재로 거듭나게 됩니다.
data_entries.content:
Department Introduction | University Introduction | Department of Artificial Intelligence  
We aim for human-centered artificial intelligence.  
In light of the pivotal role that artificial intelligence technology will play in future society and advanced technologies and industries, there is a need for a Department of Artificial Intelligence that will take the lead in cultivating ethical talents with excellent expertise capable of systematically and comprehensively understanding and utilizing diverse and complex core artificial intelligence technologies. Established in April 2020, the department strives to achieve high-quality education and research in the field of artificial intelligence through outstanding faculty, advanced laboratory practices, and a systematic curriculum. Furthermore, the Department of Artificial Intelligence aims to cultivate AI experts who will play a key role in renowned domestic and international companies/research institutions across all industries, including software, gaming, finance, semiconductors, healthcare, automotive, and aerospace, with international competitiveness.

The Department of Artificial Intelligence aims to nurture outstanding and ethical talents equipped with creative and practical capabilities in the field of artificial intelligence, which has established itself as a central and leading discipline in the advancement of future advanced technologies and industries. The curriculum of the Department of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Seoul focuses on practicality and convergence. The first goal is to develop the capability to create artificial intelligence technologies needed in the field. Through project-based courses such as capstone design and living labs, students will identify real-world problems and directly create the necessary artificial intelligence technologies to solve them. Another goal is to enhance the ability to integrate the latest artificial intelligence technologies through collaboration with people from various fields. Students will learn how to communicate with individuals from other disciplines through a multidisciplinary curriculum and explore the possibilities of utilizing artificial intelligence technologies in various ways. Through exchanges with members of overseas tech companies and research institutes, they will transform into global AI talents.
data_entries.summary: The Department of Artificial Intelligence, established in April 2020, focuses on cultivating ethical and skilled AI professionals capable of understanding and applying complex AI technologies across various industries. With an emphasis on high-quality education and research, the department offers a practical and interdisciplinary curriculum that includes project-based courses like capstone design and living labs, enabling students to tackle real-world problems with innovative AI solutions. Additionally, the program encourages collaboration across disciplines and international exchanges, preparing students to become competitive global AI experts in fields such as software, gaming, finance, healthcare, and more.

I will provide information about employment and admission for the Department of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Seoul.

Employment Information:

As of 2022, the overall employment rate at the University of Seoul was recorded at 70.4%. Specific employment rate data for the Department of Artificial Intelligence is not publicly available, but the demand for jobs in the artificial intelligence (AI) field is currently high across various industries, indicating a bright employment outlook. In particular, AI is an interdisciplinary field connected not only to computer science and mathematics statistics but also to all other fields, allowing students to apply their skills in various areas.

Admission Results:

The admission results for the Department of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Seoul for the 2024 academic year are as follows:

Regular Admission - Student Record-Based Regional Balance Selection:
- 50% Cut-off: 1.81 grade
- 70% Cut-off: 1.81 grade
- Number of Students Admitted: 2
- Competition Ratio: 22.5:1
- Waitlist Acceptance Rank: 2
- Actual Competition Ratio: 11.25:1

Regular Admission - Comprehensive Student Record Selection I:
- 50% Cut-off: 1.87 grade
- 70% Cut-off: 1.87 grade
- Number of Students Admitted: 4
- Competition Ratio: 29:1
- Waitlist Acceptance Rank: 1
- Actual Competition Ratio: 23.2:1

Additionally, in the regular admission general selection, there were 12 spots available with a competition ratio of 7.25:1, and the average college entrance exam percentile of the final registrants was 89.0, with a 70% cut-off of 91.3.

These results indicate the high competition and excellent performance levels in the Department of Artificial Intelligence.

For more detailed information, please refer to the official website of the Admissions Office at the University of Seoul.
data_entries.summary: The University of Seoul's Department of Artificial Intelligence reported a 70.4% overall employment rate as of 2022, with high job demand in the AI field suggesting a positive employment outlook for graduates. For the 2024 academic year, the admission results revealed high competition, with a 22.5:1 competition ratio for regional balance selection and a 29:1 ratio for comprehensive student record selection, indicating the department's rigorous standards. The average college entrance exam percentile for final registrants was 89.0, reflecting the strong academic performance of admitted students. Overall, these factors highlight the department's competitive nature and the interdisciplinary opportunities available in the AI sector.

지능정보시스템 연구실: 황혜수 교수님이 운영하시는 연구실로, 빅데이터 분석 및 정보 검색에 관한 연구를 진행합니다
data_entries.content:
The Department of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Seoul operates various research labs. The main research labs are as follows:

Artificial Intelligence Laboratory: This lab is supervised by Professor Lee Jae-ho and focuses on research in artificial intelligence and intelligent robotics.  
RESEARCH.UOS.AC.KR

Intelligent Robot Laboratory: This lab is led by Professor Yoo Ha-jin and primarily addresses the fields of artificial intelligence and voice recognition.  
RESEARCH.UOS.AC.KR

Intelligent Information Systems Laboratory: This lab is operated by Professor Hwang Hye-soo and conducts research on big data analysis and information retrieval.
data_entries.summary: The Department of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Seoul features several research labs, each focusing on different aspects of AI. The Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, supervised by Professor Lee Jae-ho, specializes in artificial intelligence and intelligent robotics. The Intelligent Robot Laboratory, led by Professor Yoo Ha-jin, concentrates on artificial intelligence and voice recognition. Additionally, the Intelligent Information Systems Laboratory, operated by Professor Hwang Hye-soo, focuses on big data analysis and information retrieval.

data_entries.content:
Here is the major academic schedule for the University of Seoul for 2025.

ADMISSION.UOS.AC.KR

January:

January 2 - January 6: Grade correction period  
January 13 - January 17: Application for early graduation for the first semester of 2025  
January 20 - January 24: Application for reinstatement for the first semester of 2025 and second application for undergraduate internal scholarships  
January 24 - February 3: Course registration basket period for students in their second year or higher and those exceeding their semesters  

February:

February 12 - February 14: Course registration for the first semester of 2025  
February 21: February 2025 (first semester of the 2024 academic year) graduation ceremony  
February 24 - February 26: Course registration basket and course registration for first-year students  
February 24 - February 27: Application for leave of absence for the first semester of 2025  
February 28: End of the second semester of the 2024 academic year  

March:

March 1: Start of the first semester of 2025  
March 4: Opening of the first semester of 2025  
March 4 - March 10: Course registration confirmation and change period  
March 4 - March 7: Third application for undergraduate internal scholarships for the first semester  
March 19 - March 21: Course registration cancellation period  
March 31: 1/4 of class days elapsed (Deadline for general leave of absence)  

April:

April 28: 2/4 of class days elapsed  

May:

May 1: Founding anniversary  
May 12 - May 15: Application for double major for the second semester of 2025  
May 20 - May 26: Supplementary class week  
May 26: 3/4 of class days elapsed  
May 26 - May 30: Application for readmission for the second semester of 2025  

June:

June 2 - June 5: Application for minor for the second semester of 2025  
June 9 - June 13: First application for undergraduate internal scholarships for the second semester of 2025  
June 17 - June 23: Final exam period  
June 17 - June 30: Deadline for grade submission  
June 24: Start of summer vacation  
June 24 - July 18: Summer session  

July:

July 1: Start of grade viewing  
July 1 - July 4: Grade correction period  
July 14 - July 18: Application for early graduation for the second semester of 2025  
July 21 - July 25: Application for reinstatement for the second semester of 2025 and second application for undergraduate internal scholarships  

August:

August 4 - August 8: Course registration for the second semester of 2025  
August 25: End of the first semester of 2025  

September:

September 1: Start of the second semester of 2025  
September 2: Opening of the second semester of 2025  
September 2 - September 8: Course registration confirmation and change period  
September 17 - September 19: Course registration cancellation period  
September 30: 1/4 of class days elapsed (Deadline for general leave of absence)  

October:

October 28: 2/4 of class days elapsed  

November:

November 25: 3/4 of class days elapsed  

December:

December 8 - December 12: First application for undergraduate internal scholarships for the first semester of 2026  
December 15 - December 19: Final exam period  
December 15 - December 29: Deadline for grade submission  
December 22: Start of winter vacation  
December 22 - January 16, 2026: Winter session  

January 2026:

January 2 - January 6: Grade correction period  
January 13 - January 17: Application for early graduation for the first semester of 2026  
January 20 - January 24: Application for reinstatement for the first semester of 2026  
January 20 - January 24: Second application for undergraduate internal scholarships for the first semester of 2026  
January 24 - February 3: Course registration basket period for students in their second year or higher and those exceeding their semesters  

February 2026:

February 12 - February 14: Course registration for the first semester of 2026  
February 21: February 2026 (first semester of the 2025 academic year) graduation ceremony  
February 24 - February 26: Course registration basket and course registration for first-year students  
February 24 - February 27: Application for leave of absence for the first semester of 2026  
February 28: End of the second semester of 2025
data_entries.summary: The University of Seoul's academic schedule for 2025 outlines key dates for admissions, course registrations, and graduation ceremonies. The first semester begins on March 1, with various periods for course registration, scholarship applications, and leave of absence requests throughout January and February. Significant events include the founding anniversary on May 1, the final exam period in June, and the start of the second semester on September 1. The year concludes with winter vacation starting December 22, followed by a winter session until January 16, 2026. Additionally, the schedule includes important deadlines for grade submissions and scholarship applications for the subsequent academic year.

image_entries.content_kr:
전주대학교 인공지능학과 학생들이 2024년 빅데이터 분석 경진대회에서 우수한 성과를 거두었습니다. 

이번 대회는 10월 31일부터 11월 2일까지 진행되었으며, 방대한 데이터를 분석하고 창의적으로 해석하여 문제 해결 능력을 겨루는 자리였습니다.

학생들은 데이터의 본질을 이해하고 핵심을 찾아내는 과정에서 각자의 인사이트를 도출하며 뛰어난 분석 능력을 발휘했습니다.

이번 성과는 학생들이 협력의 중요성을 배우고, 데이터를 통해 의미 있는 결론을 도출하는 도전임을 깨달은 값진 경험이었습니다.
image_entries.content:
Students from Jeonju University’s Department of Artificial Intelligence achieved excellent results at the 2024 Big Data Analysis Competition.

The competition took place from October 31 to November 2, providing a platform for participants to analyze vast amounts of data and creatively interpret it to demonstrate their problem-solving abilities.

The students showcased their outstanding analytical skills by deriving unique insights while understanding the essence of the data and identifying key elements.

This achievement was a valuable experience for the students, as they learned the importance of collaboration and realized the challenge of drawing meaningful conclusions from data.
image_entries.summary: Students from Jeonju University’s Department of Artificial Intelligence excelled at the 2024 Big Data Analysis Competition held from October 31 to November 2, where they demonstrated exceptional analytical skills by deriving unique insights from vast data sets. This experience highlighted the importance of collaboration and the challenges of interpreting data meaningfully.

image_entries.content_kr: 캐나다 토론토 대학에서 진행된 워크숍 프로그램에 참여한 3학년 재학생들은 지도학습, 비지도학습, 강화학습의 기초 및 실습을 배우는 소중한 기회를 가졌다. 매일 저녁, 학생들은 하루 동안 배운 내용을 발표하며 지식을 정리하는 시간을 가졌다. 이는 단순한 학습의 반복을 넘어, 자신의 이해를 점검하고 타인의 의견을 들음으로써 이해를 더욱 깊게 하는 데 큰 도움이 되었다. 이 과정을 통해 학생들은 각자의 관점을 넓히고, 깊이 있는 학습의 기회를 가질 수 있었다. 단순한 지식 습득을 넘어, 배운 내용을 실제로 적용하고, 팀워크와 소통의 중요성을 깨닫는 귀중한 경험을 하게 되었다. 또한, 캐나다의 교육 방식을 직접 경험하며 글로벌한 관점에서 학문을 탐구하는 기회를 가지게 되었다. 이번 프로그램은 학생들에게 많은 깨달음을 주었으며, 새로운 학습 방법을 통해 자기주도적인 학습 능력을 키울 수 있는 좋은 계기가 되었다. 학생들은 이 프로그램을 통해 얻은 지식과 경험을 바탕으로 앞으로의 학업과 연구에 더욱 큰 열정을 갖고 임할 수 있을 것이라고 기대된다.
image_entries.content: Third-year students participating in a workshop program at the University of Toronto in Canada had a valuable opportunity to learn the basics and practical applications of supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning. Each evening, the students presented what they had learned throughout the day, allowing them to consolidate their knowledge. This process went beyond simple repetition of learning; it was instrumental in deepening their understanding by checking their comprehension and listening to others' perspectives. Through this course, students were able to broaden their viewpoints and engage in in-depth learning experiences. They gained valuable insights that extended beyond mere knowledge acquisition, realizing the importance of applying what they learned, teamwork, and communication. Additionally, they had the chance to experience Canada's educational approach firsthand, exploring academic subjects from a global perspective. This program provided students with many insights and served as a great opportunity to develop their self-directed learning abilities through new learning methods. It is expected that the knowledge and experiences gained from this program will inspire students to approach their future studies and research with greater passion.
image_entries.summary: Third-year students at the University of Toronto participated in a workshop program focused on supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning. Each evening, they presented their daily learnings, enhancing their understanding through peer feedback and diverse perspectives. The course emphasized the application of knowledge, teamwork, and communication, while also exposing students to Canada's educational approach. This experience aimed to foster self-directed learning and inspire students to pursue future studies and research with increased passion.

image_entries.content_kr: 말레이시아 UTM 대학에서의 첫 수업은 낯설면서도 흥미로웠습니다. 현지 교수님들의 친절한 영어 설명 덕분에 영어 공부를 더 깊이 할 수 있었습니다. 이어지는 말라카-쿠알라룸푸르 방문에서는 그곳의 아름다운 풍경을 브이로그로 기록하며 새로운 문화를 접하는 즐거움을 느꼈습니다. 현지 UTM 학생들과의 만남에서는 각 나라의 전통 놀이와 음악을 서로 소개하며 즐거운 시간을 보냈습니다. 이 과정에서 다양한 문화를 경험하며, 서로의 차이를 존중하는 법을 배웠습니다. Desaru Fruit Farm을 방문하여 과일 농장을 체험하고, 스크랩북을 만들면서 창의력을 발휘하는 시간이었습니다. 이후에도 AI 관련 수업을 진행하며, 최첨단 기술을 배우는 재미를 만끽했습니다. 쉬는 날엔 현지 친구들을 만나거나 여행을 다니며 경험을 넓혔습니다. 마지막으로 그동안 진행한 프로젝트를 확인하고 수료식을 가졌습니다. 이 프로그램을 통해 다양한 것을 배웠고, 무엇보다도 스스로 성장할 수 있었던 소중한 시간이었습니다.
image_entries.content: My first class at UTM University in Malaysia was both unfamiliar and interesting. Thanks to the local professors' kind explanations in English, I was able to deepen my English studies. During the subsequent visit to Malacca and Kuala Lumpur, I enjoyed the pleasure of experiencing a new culture while documenting the beautiful scenery in a vlog. Meeting with local UTM students was a delightful time as we introduced each other's traditional games and music. Through this process, I experienced various cultures and learned to respect our differences. Visiting the Desaru Fruit Farm allowed me to experience a fruit farm and express my creativity by making a scrapbook. I also enjoyed taking AI-related classes, learning about cutting-edge technology. On my days off, I expanded my experiences by meeting local friends or traveling. Finally, we reviewed the projects we had worked on and held a graduation ceremony. Through this program, I learned a lot and, above all, it was a valuable time for my personal growth.
image_entries.summary: My first class at UTM University in Malaysia was an enriching experience where I improved my English through local professors' guidance. I explored new cultures during visits to Malacca and Kuala Lumpur, vlogging the beautiful scenery and engaging with local UTM students through traditional games and music. A visit to the Desaru Fruit Farm allowed me to express my creativity with a scrapbook, while AI-related classes introduced me to advanced technology. My free time was spent meeting local friends and traveling, culminating in a project review and graduation ceremony that highlighted my personal growth throughout the program.

image_entries.content_kr: 전주대학교 공학 1관 514호에서 인공지능혁신융합대학사업단에서 성과 우수 장학금 수여식을 진행하였습니다. 위 학생들은 1학기 동안 학과 전공 공부 및 사업단 활동에 성실하게 임하였으며 우수한 성과를 거두었습니다.
image_entries.content: A scholarship award ceremony for outstanding achievements was held at Jeonju University, Engineering Building 1, Room 514, by the College of Artificial Intelligence Innovation and Convergence Project Group. The students above have diligently engaged in their major studies and project group activities throughout the first semester and have achieved excellent results.
image_entries.summary: The College of Artificial Intelligence Innovation and Convergence Project Group at Jeonju University held a scholarship award ceremony in Room 514 of the Engineering Building 1, recognizing students for their outstanding achievements and dedication to their major studies and project group activities during the first semester.

image_entries.content_kr:
전주대학교는 인공지능을 가장 체계적이고 재밌게 배울 수 있는 곳 입니다. 인공지능을 무수한 분야에 융합할 수 있는 인재를 키웁니다.
의료, 농업, 군사, 자동차, 정책 등등 많은 곳에 적용 할 수 있도록 합니다.
image_entries.content: Jeonju University is the place where you can learn about artificial intelligence in the most systematic and enjoyable way. It cultivates talents who can integrate AI into countless fields. This includes applications in healthcare, agriculture, military, automotive, policy, and many more.
image_entries.summary: Jeonju University offers a systematic and enjoyable education in artificial intelligence, aiming to develop talents capable of integrating AI across various sectors, including healthcare, agriculture, military, automotive, and policy.

image_entries.content_kr: 전남대학교 인공지능학부는 2024 Google Cloud 기반 AI인재양성프로그램 피칭 및 네트워킹 데이를 진행하였습니다. 학생들은 전남대학교 인공지능학부에 진행하는 Google Cloud 기반 AI인재양성프로그램을 성실히 임하였고 좋은 성과를 거두었습니다.
image_entries.content: The Department of Artificial Intelligence at Chonnam National University held a pitching and networking day for the 2024 Google Cloud-based AI Talent Development Program. Students diligently participated in the Google Cloud-based AI Talent Development Program offered by the Department and achieved good results.
image_entries.summary: The Department of Artificial Intelligence at Chonnam National University organized a pitching and networking day for the 2024 Google Cloud-based AI Talent Development Program, where students actively engaged and showcased their efforts, resulting in positive outcomes from the program.

image_entries.content_kr:
AI 교과목 개발·운영(공동/특화) 하고 있다.
공동교육을 위한 표준화된 모듈형 교안 개발·운영하고 있다.
참여대학별 교육특성화 및 특화교과목 개발·운영하고 있다.
전 교과목 온라인 학습 콘텐츠(MOOC) 제공하고 있다.
image_entries.content:
Developing and operating AI courses (joint/specialized).  
Developing and operating standardized modular lesson plans for joint education.  
Developing and operating specialized courses tailored to the characteristics of participating universities.  
Providing online learning content (MOOC) for all courses.
image_entries.summary: The initiative focuses on creating and managing AI courses, including joint and specialized programs, while also developing standardized modular lesson plans for collaborative education. It aims to tailor specialized courses to the unique attributes of participating universities and offers online learning content through MOOCs for all courses.

image_entries.content_kr:
AI 핵심인재 양성을 위한 활동을 하고 있다.
미래핵심인재 양성을 위한 혁신교육모델 설계하여 교육을 진행하고 있다.국가적 차원의 AI 고등교육 플랫폼 구축 및 확산을 하고 교육을 진행하고 있다. AI 전문인력 및 AI+X 융합인력 2만명 양성을 목표로 하고 있다.
image_entries.content: Activities are being conducted to cultivate core talent in AI. An innovative educational model is being designed and implemented for the training of future core talent. There is a national effort to establish and expand an AI higher education platform, along with ongoing educational programs. The goal is to train 20,000 AI specialists and AI+X convergence professionals.
image_entries.summary: Efforts are underway to develop core talent in AI through an innovative educational model aimed at training future specialists. A national initiative is focused on establishing and expanding an AI higher education platform, complemented by ongoing educational programs, with the objective of training 20,000 AI specialists and AI+X convergence professionals.

image_entries.content_kr: 경북대학교 인공지능학과는 4차 산업혁명을 주도하는 핵심 원천 기술인 Al 분야 세계 최고 기술 경쟁력을 확보하고, Al 기반 기술혁신을 이끌어갈 우수 인재 양성을 목표로 합니다. ICT 산업, 의료 및 법률 전문분야와 융합한 교육과 연구를 통해 창의적 실무형 인재를 기르는 동시에, 차세대 Al 기술 개발에 핵심 역할을 담당할 고급인재 양성을 통해 글로벌 경쟁력 확보 및 지속가능한 사회경제적 발전에 기여하는 것을 방향성으로 잡고 운영되고 있습니다.
image_entries.content: The Department of Artificial Intelligence at Kyungpook National University aims to secure the world's top technological competitiveness in the field of AI, a core foundational technology leading the Fourth Industrial Revolution, and to cultivate outstanding talent that will drive AI-based technological innovation. Through education and research that integrates with the ICT industry, healthcare, and legal specialties, the department fosters creative, practical talent while also training advanced professionals who will play a key role in the development of next-generation AI technologies. This approach is designed to enhance global competitiveness and contribute to sustainable socio-economic development.
image_entries.summary: The Department of Artificial Intelligence at Kyungpook National University focuses on achieving global leadership in AI technology, essential for the Fourth Industrial Revolution, while nurturing exceptional talent to drive innovation. By integrating education and research with the ICT industry, healthcare, and legal fields, the department aims to develop creative professionals and advanced experts who will contribute to next-generation AI advancements and promote sustainable socio-economic growth.

image_entries.content_kr:
영진전문학교 인공지능 학과
4차 산업혁명의 거대한 흐름에 대처하기 위해 대학도 기존의 교육과정과 시스템을 뛰어넘는 패러다임 전환의 시대를 거역할 수 없는 상황입니다.
AI융합기계계열은 4차 산업혁명이라는 혁신적 기술 변화를 반영하여, 기계, 자동차, 가공 중심의 기존의 전통적인 교육과정에 인공지능(AI), 3D프린팅, 로보틱스, 초정밀금형, 에너지화학, 미래형자동차 등의 첨단기술분야를 융복합하여 미래융합 기계산업분야 핵심전문기술 인력을 양성하고자 합니다.
1학년 1학기는 계열 공통과정을 교육하고, 1학년 2학기부터 학생들의 희망에 따라 스마트기계설계과, 로봇자동화과, 스마트CAD/CAM과, 에너지화학플랜트과, 미래자동차설계과 5개 학과에 배치되어 전공코스 교육을 운영합니다.
또한 디지털 신기술 혁신공유대학에 선정되어 전문대학 유일의 지능형 로봇분야 인력을 연간 350명을 양성 하기 위해 한양대(ERICA), 광운대, 상명대, 부경대, 조선대, 한국산업기술대 등과 지능형 로봇분야 공동 교육 및 공동 학위 과정을 운영 합니다. 학사학위 전공심화과정을 운영하여 4년제 대학의 교육체제에 실무적 전문 성을 겸비한 중간 관리자로서의 학사학위를 가진 전문 기술 엔지니어를 양성합니다.
그리고, 전문대학 기계분야 최초로 마이스터대학 시범운영사업에 선정되어 2022학년도부터 전문기술석사과정도 운영합니다.
image_entries.content:
Yongjin Professional School Artificial Intelligence Department

In response to the massive wave of the Fourth Industrial Revolution, universities are in an unavoidable situation of undergoing a paradigm shift that transcends existing curricula and systems. The AI Convergence Mechanical Engineering program reflects the innovative technological changes of the Fourth Industrial Revolution by integrating advanced technology fields such as artificial intelligence (AI), 3D printing, robotics, ultra-precision molding, energy chemistry, and future automotive design into the traditional curriculum centered on machinery, automobiles, and processing. The aim is to cultivate key professional talents in the future convergence mechanical industry.

In the first semester of the first year, a common curriculum for the program is taught. From the second semester of the first year, students are assigned to one of five specialized departments—Smart Machine Design, Robotics Automation, Smart CAD/CAM, Energy Chemistry Plant, and Future Automotive Design—based on their preferences, where they will receive specialized course education.

Additionally, the school has been selected as a Digital New Technology Innovation Sharing University and collaborates with Hanyang University (ERICA), Kwangwoon University, Sangmyung University, Pukyong National University, Chosun University, and Korea University of Technology and Education to provide joint education and joint degree programs in the field of intelligent robotics, aiming to train 350 professionals annually. A bachelor's degree program with a focus on practical expertise is also offered to cultivate specialized technical engineers with a bachelor's degree who can serve as mid-level managers within the educational system of four-year universities.

Furthermore, the school has been selected for the Meister University pilot operation project, becoming the first in the mechanical field of vocational colleges to operate a specialized master's program starting from the 2022 academic year.
image_entries.summary: Yongjin Professional School's Artificial Intelligence Department is adapting to the Fourth Industrial Revolution by integrating advanced technologies like AI, 3D printing, and robotics into its mechanical engineering curriculum. The program begins with a common curriculum in the first semester, followed by specialization in areas such as Smart Machine Design and Robotics Automation from the second semester. Collaborating with several universities, it aims to train 350 professionals annually in intelligent robotics and offers a bachelor's degree focused on practical expertise for mid-level management roles. Additionally, it has launched a specialized master's program as part of the Meister University pilot project.

image_entries.content_kr:
AI 기반 디지털 혁신 인재 양성
현장 기반 문제해결을 지향하며 사회적 가치 창출 인재를 양성함
전공 소개
인공지능 기술을 기반으로 한 실용적이고 현장중심의 교육을 바탕으로 미래 통찰력을 겸비한 디지털 트랜스포메이션 시대의 인재를 양성하고자 응용AI융합학부가 설립되었습니다.
응용AI융합학부는 AI융합운영전공, 산업인공지능전공이라는 두 가지 전공으로 나뉘며, 응용AI융합학부 입학생은 교양·기초과목을 이수한 후 2학년 진급 시 모집단위에 설치된 전공을 대상으로 본인의 희망과 1학년 학업성적에 따라 각 전공에 진입하게 됩니다.
image_entries.content:
AI-Based Digital Innovation Talent Development  
Fostering talent that creates social value through field-based problem-solving.  

Major Introduction  
The Department of Applied AI Convergence was established to cultivate talent equipped with future insights for the digital transformation era, based on practical and field-centered education grounded in artificial intelligence technology. The Department of Applied AI Convergence is divided into two majors: AI Convergence Operations and Industrial Artificial Intelligence. Students admitted to the Department will complete general and foundational courses and, upon advancing to their second year, will enter their chosen major based on their preferences and first-year academic performance.
image_entries.summary: The Department of Applied AI Convergence aims to develop talent for the digital transformation era through practical, field-centered education in artificial intelligence. It offers two majors: AI Convergence Operations and Industrial Artificial Intelligence. Students will complete foundational courses before selecting their major in the second year, based on their preferences and academic performance.

image_entries.content_kr:
서울과학기술대학교 인공지능 AI응용학과 소개
AI응용학과에서는 4차 산업혁명 시대에 인공지능 분야를 선도할 융합형 인재를 양성합니다.
인공지능(Intelligence)과 산업(Industry) 연계를 통해, 인공지능 전문가를 넘어 산업과 인공지능을 리딩할 수 있는 준비된 인재를 육성하는 데에 교육 목적이 있습니다
AI for all students, AI for every major
AI응용학과 학생들은 1, 2학년에 인공지능의 기초 및 핵심기술에 대해 학습하고 3학년부터 인공지능 모델 개발, 인공지능 서비스 기획 등 실제로 인공지능 지식을 바탕으로 제품과 서비스를 만들어 볼 수 있는 프로젝트 기반의 교육을 받습니다.
또한 AI 이외에 학습자의 관심분야(소프트웨어, 기계, 로봇, 환경, 전자, 반도체, 바이오, 신소재, 디자인, 건축, 화학, 인문, 경영)를 복수 전공하도록 하여 AI응용분야의 전문가를 양성할 수 있도록 합니다.
image_entries.content:
Introduction to the Department of AI Applications at Seoul National University of Science and Technology

The Department of AI Applications cultivates convergent talents who will lead the field of artificial intelligence in the era of the Fourth Industrial Revolution. Our educational goal is to nurture prepared individuals who can lead both industry and artificial intelligence, going beyond just being AI experts through the connection between intelligence and industry.

AI for all students, AI for every major

Students in the Department of AI Applications learn the fundamentals and core technologies of artificial intelligence in their first and second years. Starting in their third year, they receive project-based education that allows them to create products and services based on their knowledge of AI, focusing on AI model development and AI service planning. Additionally, students are encouraged to pursue double majors in their areas of interest (such as software, machinery, robotics, environment, electronics, semiconductors, bio, new materials, design, architecture, chemistry, humanities, and management) to become experts in the field of AI applications.
image_entries.summary: The Department of AI Applications at Seoul National University of Science and Technology aims to develop versatile talents capable of leading in artificial intelligence during the Fourth Industrial Revolution. The curriculum emphasizes foundational AI knowledge in the first two years, followed by project-based learning in the third year, focusing on AI model development and service planning. Students are encouraged to pursue double majors across various disciplines, enhancing their expertise in AI applications across multiple fields.

image_entries.content: Introduction to the Department of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Seoul
image_entries.summary: The Department of Artificial Intelligence at the University of Seoul focuses on advancing research and education in AI technologies, offering innovative programs that equip students with essential skills in machine learning, data analysis, and robotics. The department aims to foster interdisciplinary collaboration and contribute to cutting-edge developments in the field, preparing graduates for impactful careers in academia and industry.
